required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Analgesic Use for Pain Relief in Scorpion Sting
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of iv Paracetamol, iv Dexketoprofen and Topical Lidocaine in Scorpion Sting: a Placebo Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: In scorpion stings, patients mostly apply with the complaint of pain. Emergency physicians need to relieve this pain quickly.

detailed_description.textblock:
Aim: In this study, the analgesic efficacy of intravenous (IV) paracetamol, IV dexketoprofen trometamol and topical lidocaine will be compared in patients presenting with pain after scorpion sting.
Methods: This study is a double-blind, randomized, placebo-controlled study conducted in a tertiary emergency department. Adult patients who applied to the study with no systemic findings after scorpion sting and especially with pain will be randomly assigned to one of 4 groups: IV paracetamol, IV dexketoprofen trometamol, topical lidocaine or placebo. In order to determine the intensity of pain, Visual Analog Pain Score (VAS) will be measured at the time of admission to the emergency department, at the 30th minute and at the 60th minute. Afterwards, the VAS score changes between the groups will be compared.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change of the intensity of pain
primary_outcome.time_frame: 15 minutes and 30 minutes after the study drug administered
primary_outcome.description: Pain intense will be measured by 100 mm visual analog scale (Zero; no pain and 100 mm; the worst pain) after 15th and 30th minutes later after the study drug administered

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes after the study drug administered
secondary_outcome.description: 30 minutes after the study drug administered

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes after the study drug administered
secondary_outcome.description: 30 minutes after the study drug administered

arm_group.description: 100 mL intravenous normal saline+ placebo topical pomade

intervention.description: 1000 mg intravenous paracetamol in 100 mL normal saline
50 mg intravenous dexketoprofen Trometamol in 100 mL normal saline

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged 18 and over with scorpion sting with pain who met the diagnostic criteria of Grade 1.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who denied to give informed consent, patients taking analgesic treatment (ice application or drugs etc.) in the last 6 hours, Patients with any symptoms and findings of systemic toxicity of scorpion sting, pregnant women, hemodynamically unstable patients, patients known allergy to drugs of the study.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Adiyaman University Medical Faculty of Research and Training Hospital
